001package io.particle;
002
003import java.math.BigInteger;
004import java.security.SecureRandom;
005
006import org.bouncycastle.crypto.CryptoException;
007import org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest;
008import org.bouncycastle.crypto.SavableDigest;
009import org.bouncycastle.crypto.agreement.jpake.JPAKEParticipant;
010import org.bouncycastle.crypto.agreement.jpake.JPAKEPrimeOrderGroup;
011import org.bouncycastle.crypto.agreement.jpake.JPAKEPrimeOrderGroups;
012import org.bouncycastle.crypto.agreement.jpake.JPAKERound1Payload;
013import org.bouncycastle.crypto.agreement.jpake.JPAKERound2Payload;
014import org.bouncycastle.crypto.agreement.jpake.JPAKERound3Payload;
015import org.bouncycastle.crypto.digests.RIPEMD160Digest;
016import org.bouncycastle.crypto.digests.SHA256Digest;
017
018/**
019 * An example of a J-PAKE exchange.
020 * <p>
021 *
022 * In this example, both Alice and Bob are on the same computer (in the same JVM, in fact).
023 * In reality, Alice and Bob would be in different locations,
024 * and would be sending their generated payloads to each other.
025 */
026public class TestBouncycastle
027{
028
029    public static void main(String args[]) throws CryptoException
030    {
031        // -DM 45 System.out.print
032        /*
033         * Initialization
034         *
035         * Pick an appropriate prime order group to use throughout the exchange.
036         * Note that both participants must use the same group.
037         */
038        JPAKEPrimeOrderGroup group = JPAKEPrimeOrderGroups.NIST_2048;
039
040        BigInteger p = group.getP();
041        BigInteger q = group.getQ();
042        BigInteger g = group.getG();
043
044        String alicePassword = "123456";
045        String bobPassword = "123456";
046
047        System.out.println("********* Initialization **********");
048        System.out.println("Public parameters for the cyclic group:");
049        System.out.println("p (" + p.bitLength() + " bits): " + p.toString(16));
050        System.out.println("q (" + q.bitLength() + " bits): " + q.toString(16));
051        System.out.println("g (" + p.bitLength() + " bits): " + g.toString(16));
052        System.out.println("p mod q = " + p.mod(q).toString(16));
053        System.out.println("g^{q} mod p = " + g.modPow(q, p).toString(16));
054        System.out.println("");
055
056        System.out.println("(Secret passwords used by Alice and Bob: " +
057                "\"" + alicePassword + "\" and \"" + bobPassword + "\")\n");
058
059        /*
060         * Both participants must use the same hashing algorithm.
061         */
062        Digest digest = new RIPEMD160Digest();
063        SecureRandom random = new SecureRandom();
064
065        JPAKEParticipant alice = new JPAKEParticipant("alice", alicePassword.toCharArray(), group, digest, random);
066        JPAKEParticipant bob = new JPAKEParticipant("bob", bobPassword.toCharArray(), group, digest, random);
067
068        /*
069         * Round 1
070         *
071         * Alice and Bob each generate a round 1 payload, and send it to each other.
072         */
073
074        JPAKERound1Payload aliceRound1Payload = alice.createRound1PayloadToSend();
075        JPAKERound1Payload bobRound1Payload = bob.createRound1PayloadToSend();
076
077        System.out.println("************ Round 1 **************");
078        System.out.println("Alice sends to Bob: ");
079        System.out.println("g^{x1}=" + aliceRound1Payload.getGx1().toString(16));
080        System.out.println("g^{x2}=" + aliceRound1Payload.getGx2().toString(16));
081        System.out.println("KP{x1}={" + aliceRound1Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX1()[0].toString(16) + "};{" + aliceRound1Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX1()[1].toString(16) + "}");
082        System.out.println("KP{x2}={" + aliceRound1Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX2()[0].toString(16) + "};{" + aliceRound1Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX2()[1].toString(16) + "}");
083        System.out.println("");
084
085        System.out.println("Bob sends to Alice: ");
086        System.out.println("g^{x3}=" + bobRound1Payload.getGx1().toString(16));
087        System.out.println("g^{x4}=" + bobRound1Payload.getGx2().toString(16));
088        System.out.println("KP{x3}={" + bobRound1Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX1()[0].toString(16) + "};{" + bobRound1Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX1()[1].toString(16) + "}");
089        System.out.println("KP{x4}={" + bobRound1Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX2()[0].toString(16) + "};{" + bobRound1Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX2()[1].toString(16) + "}");
090        System.out.println("");
091
092        /*
093         * Each participant must then validate the received payload for round 1
094         */
095
096        alice.validateRound1PayloadReceived(bobRound1Payload);
097        System.out.println("Alice checks g^{x4}!=1: OK");
098        System.out.println("Alice checks KP{x3}: OK");
099        System.out.println("Alice checks KP{x4}: OK");
100        System.out.println("");
101
102        bob.validateRound1PayloadReceived(aliceRound1Payload);
103        System.out.println("Bob checks g^{x2}!=1: OK");
104        System.out.println("Bob checks KP{x1},: OK");
105        System.out.println("Bob checks KP{x2},: OK");
106        System.out.println("");
107
108        /*
109         * Round 2
110         *
111         * Alice and Bob each generate a round 2 payload, and send it to each other.
112         */
113
114        JPAKERound2Payload aliceRound2Payload = alice.createRound2PayloadToSend();
115        JPAKERound2Payload bobRound2Payload = bob.createRound2PayloadToSend();
116
117        System.out.println("************ Round 2 **************");
118        System.out.println("Alice sends to Bob: ");
119        System.out.println("A=" + aliceRound2Payload.getA().toString(16));
120        System.out.println("KP{x2*s}={" + aliceRound2Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX2s()[0].toString(16) + "},{" + aliceRound2Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX2s()[1].toString(16) + "}");
121        System.out.println("");
122
123        System.out.println("Bob sends to Alice");
124        System.out.println("B=" + bobRound2Payload.getA().toString(16));
125        System.out.println("KP{x4*s}={" + bobRound2Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX2s()[0].toString(16) + "},{" + bobRound2Payload.getKnowledgeProofForX2s()[1].toString(16) + "}");
126        System.out.println("");
127
128        /*
129         * Each participant must then validate the received payload for round 2
130         */
131
132        alice.validateRound2PayloadReceived(bobRound2Payload);
133        System.out.println("Alice checks KP{x4*s}: OK\n");
134
135        bob.validateRound2PayloadReceived(aliceRound2Payload);
136        System.out.println("Bob checks KP{x2*s}: OK\n");
137
138        /*
139         * After round 2, each participant computes the keying material.
140         */
141
142        BigInteger aliceKeyingMaterial = alice.calculateKeyingMaterial();
143        BigInteger bobKeyingMaterial = bob.calculateKeyingMaterial();
144
145        System.out.println("********* After round 2 ***********");
146        System.out.println("Alice computes key material \t K=" + aliceKeyingMaterial.toString(16));
147        System.out.println("Bob computes key material \t K=" + bobKeyingMaterial.toString(16));
148        System.out.println();
149
150
151        /*
152         * You must derive a session key from the keying material applicable
153         * to whatever encryption algorithm you want to use.
154         */
155
156        BigInteger aliceKey = deriveSessionKey(aliceKeyingMaterial);
157        BigInteger bobKey = deriveSessionKey(bobKeyingMaterial);
158
159        /*
160         * At this point, you can stop and use the session keys if you want.
161         * This is implicit key confirmation.
162         *
163         * If you want to explicitly confirm that the key material matches,
164         * you can continue on and perform round 3.
165         */
166
167        /*
168         * Round 3
169         *
170         * Alice and Bob each generate a round 3 payload, and send it to each other.
171         */
172
173        JPAKERound3Payload aliceRound3Payload = alice.createRound3PayloadToSend(aliceKeyingMaterial);
174        JPAKERound3Payload bobRound3Payload = bob.createRound3PayloadToSend(bobKeyingMaterial);
175
176        // -DM 11grad System.out.println
177        System.out.println("************ Round 3 **************");
178        System.out.println("Alice sends to Bob: ");
179        System.out.println("MacTag=" + aliceRound3Payload.getMacTag().toString(16));
180        System.out.println("");
181        System.out.println("Bob sends to Alice: ");
182        System.out.println("MacTag=" + bobRound3Payload.getMacTag().toString(16));
183        System.out.println("");
184
185        /*
186         * Each participant must then validate the received payload for round 3
187         */
188
189        alice.validateRound3PayloadReceived(bobRound3Payload, aliceKeyingMaterial);
190        System.out.println("Alice checks MacTag: OK\n");
191
192        bob.validateRound3PayloadReceived(aliceRound3Payload, bobKeyingMaterial);
193        System.out.println("Bob checks MacTag: OK\n");
194
195        System.out.println();
196        System.out.println("MacTags validated, therefore the keying material matches.");
197    }
198
199    private static BigInteger deriveSessionKey(BigInteger keyingMaterial)
200    {
201        /*
202         * You should use a secure key derivation function (KDF) to derive the session key.
203         *
204         * For the purposes of this example, I'm just going to use a hash of the keying material.
205         */
206        SavableDigest digest = SHA256Digest.newInstance();
207
208        byte[] keyByteArray = keyingMaterial.toByteArray();
209
210        byte[] output = new byte[digest.getDigestSize()];
211
212        digest.update(keyByteArray, 0, keyByteArray.length);
213
214        digest.doFinal(output, 0);
215
216        return new BigInteger(output);
217    }
218}
